intro: Viola patrinii var. triangularis, commonly known as the triangular violet, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, with five petals arranged in a symmetrical pattern. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or alpine settings.
